name: Living a Legend
description: A second contact visit with the Sikarians goes awry when one of their ships is stolen. With their technical ability to fold space, retrieving the ship is key. Punctuate this thrilling adventure with a happily ever after!
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Labin, Pike, Jellico, Doopler Emissary, Diplomats, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the Sikarian Vessel, the Borg Sphere 878, or the Suurok-class Combat Cruiser will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Labin, Pike, Jellico, Doopler Emissary, or Diplomats

featured_crew.name: Booker
featured_crew.flavor: Booker cautions that pain isn’t how loved ones should be honored, and the 10-C understand. Their empathetic breakthrough halts the DMA.

action.name: That Is The Start of Making Things Right

featured_crew.name: Pike
featured_crew.flavor: Pike goes undercover on Kiley 279 to avert a nuclear conflict that should never have been made possible in the first place

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Suurok Class Combat Cruiser Ship Schematic
rewards.full_name: Suurok Class Combat Cruiser Ship Schematic

ship.name: Suurok Class Combat Cruiser
ship.flavor: Used as both a Combat Cruiser or a Science Vessel, the Suurok Class was among the fastest and most powerful starships operating in the Vulcan fleet.

rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Booker
rewards.flavor: Booker cautions that pain isn’t how loved ones should be honored, and the 10-C understand. Their empathetic breakthrough halts the DMA.

action.name: That Is The Start of Making Things Right

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "Thanks for answering my hails, Captain. I was just sharing with our Sikarian visitors here about that time we dented the Guardian of Forever and had to buff it. Bunch of crew members decided this was a chance for shore leave and it was chaos."

"I would love to meet this Guardian of Forever. What incredible tales it must have to tell. Alas, that isn't why we hailed you. While we were enjoying Captain Freeman's hospitality, one of our ships went missing. All of my crew are accounted for and the ship isn't responding."
"Sikarian ships have valuable technology at their disposal. It could be a disaster if that ship fell into the wrong hands. Subdue it so we can return it to them."

"Thanks for answering my hails, Captain. I was just sharing with our Sikarian visitors here about that time we dented the Guardian of Forever and had to buff it. Bunch of crew members decided this was a chance for shore leave and it was chaos."

"I would love to meet this Guardian of Forever. What incredible tales it must have to tell. Alas, that isn't why we hailed you. While we were enjoying Captain Freeman's hospitality, one of our ships went missing. All of my crew are accounted for and the ship isn't responding."
"Sikarian ships have valuable technology at their disposal. It could be a disaster if that ship fell into the wrong hands. Subdue it so we can return it to them."
"Your efforts are appreciated, Captain. Unfortunately, it appears whoever is piloting the Sikarian ship has figured out how to use their technology to 'fold' space, as it were."
"Oh no, oh no, if they can fold space, they can get anywhere in a jiff. An intergalactic incident on my watch? This is gonna reflect so poorly on me!"

responses.text: "Any ideas on who would do this?"
"Telling him to calm down often has the opposite effect."

screens.text: "Calm down, my duplicating friend. This is exciting! And the curtain hasn't fallen yet!"
"Of course. But what's a good adventure tale without a little rising action?"
"Unfortunately when others learn of our technology, their greed quickly outstrips any desire to genuinely interact with us. I had hoped this time would be different."
"Oh no, I've already got a reputation with this Captain too. You think I'm high-strung, is that it? This is so embarrassing!"
"The most important thing right now is retrieving that ship. We're counting on you!"
"Your efforts are appreciated, Captain. Unfortunately, it appears whoever is piloting the Sikarian ship has figured out how to use their technology to 'fold' space, as it were."
"Oh no, oh no, if they can fold space, they can get anywhere in a jiff. An intergalactic incident on my watch? This is gonna reflect so poorly on me!"

responses.text: "Any ideas on who would do this?"
"Telling him to calm down often has the opposite effect."

screens.text: "Calm down, my duplicating friend. This is exciting! And the curtain hasn't fallen yet!"
"Of course. But what's a good adventure tale without a little rising action?"
"Unfortunately when others learn of our technology, their greed quickly outstrips any desire to genuinely interact with us. I had hoped this time would be different."
"Oh no, I've already got a reputation with this Captain too. You think I'm high-strung, is that it? This is so embarrassing!"
"The most important thing right now is retrieving that ship. We're counting on you!"
